item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, September 10, 2024 at 9:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. An NFC movie library for my kids (608 points | 130 comments)
2. Radiology-specific foundation model (112 points | 40 comments)
3. Make Your Own Read-Only Device with NetBSD (13 points | discuss)
4. Tech Apple loses EU court battle over 13B euro tax bill in Ireland (73 points | 52 comments)
5. Huawei Unveils $2,800 Trifold Mate XT Just Hours After Apple Launches iPhone 16 (8 points | 2 comments)
6. EU Court: Apple received EUR 13B illegal tax subsidy [pdf] (50 points | 29 comments)
7. Windows NT vs. Unix: A design comparison (409 points | 350 comments)
8. Warner Brothers Cartoon Companion (37 points | 6 comments)
9. Affordable DE10-Nano compatible boards for MiSTer FPGA retro platform (87 points | 22 comments)
10. Show HN: Vomitorium – all of your project in 1 text file (24 points | 10 comments)
11. Carpentopod: A Walking Table Project (177 points | 17 comments)
12. Taildrop lets you send files between your personal devices on Tailscale network (9 points | 1 comment)
13. 2016 was first year on record for zero roof fall fatalities in coal mining in US (15 points | 4 comments)
14. Sigrok – a portable, cross-platform, FOSS signal analysis software suite (96 points | 10 comments)
15. Project Hammer: reduce collusion in the Canadian grocery sector (289 points | 194 comments)
16. Sqlc: Compile SQL to type-safe code (148 points | 62 comments)
17. DOJ claims Google has "trifecta of monopolies" on Day 1 of ad tech trial (229 points | 158 comments)
18. Launch HN: Deepsilicon (YC S24) – Software and hardware for ternary transformers (159 points | 58 comments)
19. Estimating Bidders' Valuation Distributions in Online Auctions (2005) [pdf] (17 points | discuss)
20. iPhone 16 Pro and iPhone 16 Pro Max (521 points | 1267 comments)
21. Cecilia Payne-Gaposchkin discovered that stars are mostly made of hydrogen (70 points | 18 comments)
22. B-Trees and Database Indexes (222 points | 38 comments)
23. Litecli: CLI for SQLite Databases with auto-completion and syntax highlighting (79 points | 8 comments)
24. Synthetic diamonds are now purer, more beautiful, and cheaper than mined (657 points | 359 comments)
25. Just for Fun (2022) (227 points | 64 comments)
26. Transfusion: Predict the next token and diffuse images with one multimodal model (93 points | 5 comments)
27. Hacking misconfigured AWS S3 buckets: A complete guide (202 points | 38 comments)
28. Why GitHub won (488 points | 407 comments)
29. Every webpage deserves to be a place (103 points | 29 comments)
30. FTC Pushed to Crack Down on Companies That Ruin Hardware via Software Updates (341 points | 143 comments)
